meanings.definition: To cause to become separate or disconnected.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind was disuniting the branches from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The disagreement between the friends was disuniting their bond.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was disuniting the nuts from the pile.
meanings.sent4: The magician's trick seemed to disunite reality from illusion.
meanings.sent5: The scissors worked like magic, disuniting the paper effortlessly.

meanings.definition: To break up or dissolve the unity or harmony of.
meanings.sent1: The loud argument was disuniting the peaceful atmosphere of the room.
meanings.sent2: The negative comments were disuniting the team's morale.
meanings.sent3: The prankster was disuniting the seriousness of the meeting with jokes.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to disunite the calmness of the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes skillfully disunited the colors on the canvas.
